abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie plans to ask FedEx for help developing tracking system for immigrants; speech in New Hampshire aimed at reviving his campaign claims country loses track of 40 percent of legal immigrants who overstay their visas; Republican candidates including Donald J Trump have taken increasingly hard line on immigration issues.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey said if he became president he would combat illegal immigration by creating a way to track foreign visitors and ask the chief executive of FedEx to devise the system.

headline.main: Chris Christie Proposes Tracking Immigrants the Way FedEx Tracks Packages
headline.print_headline: Christie Proposes Immigrant Tracker Similar to FedEx

snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey said if he became president he would combat illegal immigration by creating a way to track foreign visitors and ask the chief executive of FedEx to devise the system.
